dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Informative and enthusiastic discussion about technology news.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Starlink just secured nearly 900 million dollars from the FCC.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Starlink just secured nearly nine hundred million dollars from the F C C.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musks SpaceX won $885.5 million in subsidies from the Federal Communications Commission Monday to provide rural areas with high-speed internet through its Starlink satellite project, a major win for the Musk-led company and its first publicly announced major customer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, SpaceX got almost a billion in subsidies? That's huge for their rural internet plan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, SpaceX got almost a billion in subsidies? That's huge for their rural internet plan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musks SpaceX won $885.5 million in subsidies from the Federal Communications Commission Monday to provide rural areas with high-speed internet through its Starlink satellite project, a major win for the Musk-led company and its first publicly announced major customer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, 887.5 million to be exact. And they were the only satellite operator among the top bidders.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, eight hundred eighty seven point five million to be exact. And they were the only satellite operator among the top bidders.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musks SpaceX won $885.5 million in subsidies from the Federal Communications Commission Monday to provide rural areas with high-speed internet through its Starlink satellite project, a major win for the Musk-led company and its first publicly announced major customer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's gonna cover over 640,000 locations across 36 states. I mean, that's massive reach for Starlink.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's gonna cover over six hundred forty thousand locations across thirty six states. I mean, that's massive reach for Starlink.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The FCC says the money will allow SpaceXs Starlink project to reach 35 states across 642,925 locations, while the only other satellite company to win subsidies in the auction, Maryland-based Hughes Network Systems, won $1.3 million serving 3,678 locations in one state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And get this—this is their first publicly announced major customer. The government itself.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get this-this is their first publicly announced major customer. The government itself.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The government is Starlinks first publicly-announced major customer, in addition to its partnership with Microsoft to provide its Azure cloud computing services over the network.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so it's like a validation of the whole project. Plus they're working with Microsoft Azure too, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, so it's like a validation of the whole project. Plus they're working with Microsoft Azure too, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The government is Starlinks first publicly-announced major customer, in addition to its partnership with Microsoft to provide its Azure cloud computing services over the network.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Caleb Henry from Quilty Analytics called it an 'anchor customer' for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Caleb Henry from Quilty Analytics called it an 'anchor customer' for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is great for SpaceX because now they have an anchor customer, Quilty Analytics senior analyst Caleb Henry told CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is uh, super important when you're trying to scale up something as ambitious as putting tens of thousands of satellites in orbit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is uh, super important when you're trying to scale up something as ambitious as putting tens of thousands of satellites in orbit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, 42,500 satellites eventually. They only have around 900 up now, so this funding is a game-changer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, forty two thousand, five hundred satellites eventually. They only have around nine hundred up now, so this funding is a game-changer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starlinks service is still nascentit only went into public beta over the summer with nearly 900 satellitesbut the company has ambitious plans to put 42,000 satellites into orbit for widespread high-speed internet access.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it makes sense timing-wise too, with the pandemic highlighting how crucial internet access is, especially in rural areas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it makes sense timing-wise too, with the pandemic highlighting how crucial internet access is, especially in rural areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, like only 78% of rural Americans had high-speed broadband as of 2018. That gap is really showing now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, like only seventy eight percent of rural Americans had high-speed broadband as of twenty eighteen. That gap is really showing now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At a time when work and school activities are being held online, only 77% of the population in rural areas of the U.S. have access to high-speed broadband internet, according to 2018 data from the FCC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not just SpaceX—Amazon's Project Kuiper is also getting into the satellite internet race.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not just SpaceX-Amazon's Project Kuiper is also getting into the satellite internet race.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A number of private companies are launching their own satellites into low-earth orbit in a bid to dominate the commercial space market, including Amazon with its satellite internet program Project Kuiper.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, but this subsidy definitely gives Starlink a head start in building out that infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but this subsidy definitely gives Starlink a head start in building out that infrastructure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's a big step toward making global satellite internet a reality.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's a big step toward making global satellite internet a reality.

artist_script:
Starlink just secured nearly 900 million dollars from the FCC.
HostB: Wait, SpaceX got almost a billion in subsidies? That’s huge for their rural internet plan.
HostA: Yeah, 887.5 million to be exact. And they were the only satellite operator among the top bidders.
HostB: That’s gonna cover over 640,000 locations across 36 states. I mean, that’s massive reach for Starlink.
HostA: And get this—this is their first publicly announced major customer. The government itself.
HostB: Oh wow, so it’s like a validation of the whole project. Plus they’re working with Microsoft Azure too, right?
HostA: Exactly. And Caleb Henry from Quilty Analytics called it an ‘anchor customer’ for them.
HostB: Which is uh, super important when you’re trying to scale up something as ambitious as putting tens of thousands of satellites in orbit.
HostA: Yeah, 42,500 satellites eventually. They only have around 900 up now, so this funding is a game-changer.
HostB: And it makes sense timing-wise too, with the pandemic highlighting how crucial internet access is, especially in rural areas.
HostA: Right, like only 78% of rural Americans had high-speed broadband as of 2018. That gap is really showing now.
HostB: But it’s not just SpaceX—Amazon’s Project Kuiper is also getting into the satellite internet race.
HostA: True, but this subsidy definitely gives Starlink a head start in building out that infrastructure.
HostB: Absolutely. It’s a big step toward making global satellite internet a reality.
